Why would you contact them?: Cars for Charity, Inc. is a Colorado 501(c)3 non-profit organization. The purpose and mission of Cars for Charity, Inc. is to act as an enabling entity for other non-profit organizations. Many non-profit organizations are unable to have an in-house vehicle donation program, because they financially are unable to spend the money required by the Colorado Department of Revenue to obtain a Dealer's License, bond and do not have the staff, time and expertise to manage an in-house program. Cars for Charity, Inc. eliminates these obstacles. Cars for Charity holds the Dealer's License, the motor vehicle bond, and brokers the donated vehicles to the appropriate facility for direct sale, auction or as scrap.

Name/Title: Domiciliary Care for Homeless Vets DCHV
Why would you contact them?: 24/7 residential medical support to help veterans rebuild their lives; The Domiciliary Care Program is the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) oldest health care program. Established through legislation passed in the late 1860's, the Domiciliary's purpose was to provide a home for disabled volunteer soldiers of the Civil War. Domiciliary care was initially established to provide services to economically-disadvantaged Veterans, and it remains committed to serving that group. The Domiciliary has evolved from a "Soldiers' Home" to become an active clinical rehabilitation and treatment program for male and female Veterans and domiciliary programs are is now integrated with the Mental Health Residential Rehabilitation and Treatment Programs (MH RRTPs).

Wellness program that will focus on foundational information regarding sleep hygiene, nutrition practices, and movement (aka…exercise). Sleep is the foundation for restoring and enhancing learning, an integral part in recovery as we must learn and implement the skills offered during individual and group sessions. Adequate and nourishing food allows the body and mind to heal from years of neglect. Nutrients that are protective of health and the immune system will allow us to decrease time spent feeling ill and missing work or other important appointments. Movement is the pathway for releasing all the happy chemicals that will fuel motivation, connection to self and others, and increased self-esteem and confidence. Be assured that the intention is a slow and progressive implementation of the habits you feel are achievable.
